description.narrative: Health emergency preparedness and response with special focus on children and women of child bearing age is implemented by the GoSL, UNICEF and its partners in a timely manner during the country programme cycle,which contributes to Child Health, Health And Emergencies, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable use of high-impact maternal and child health intervention from pregnancy to adolescence and promotion of health behaviours

sector.narrative: Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Health emergency preparedness and response with special focus on children and women of child bearing age is implemented by the GoSL, UNICEF and its partners in a timely manner during the country programme cycle

description.narrative: Emergency responses by the Government in 2019 were rapid, exemplified by the reactive vaccination campaign in response to measles outbreak in Pujehun and Kambia districts. These were supported through campaign planning, vaccine procurement and distribution, provision of campaign logistics, and social mobilization. As a result, 320,692 children aged 6 months to under 15 years were vaccinated against measles and transmission was interrupted. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of pregnant women and under-five children reached with emergency health services during emergencies
Comprehensive multi-sectoral cholera preparedness plan available
